<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SOCIAL MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/08/05/el-paso-attacks-traced-darkest-reaches-internet?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Attacks Traced to “Darkest Reaches of the Internet”
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="No Alt" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83MTIwL2VsX3Bhc29fc2t5bGluZTJfanBnLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>The El Paso skyline</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">After Saturday’s massacre in El Paso, the online message board 8chan has now figured prominently in three attacks this year. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The man accused of killing 51 people at two mosques in Christchurch, NZ, in March </span><span><a href="https://slate.com/news-and-politics/2019/03/what-the-christchurch-attackers-manifesto-tells-us.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">posted</a></span><span> a manifesto to 8chan filled with racist ideology. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The next month, the Poway, CA, synagogue shooter </span><span><a href="https://www.cnn.com/2019/04/29/us/san-diego-synagogue-shooting-fbi-tip/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">posted a link</a></span><span> on 8chan to an anti-Semitic letter he appeared to have written. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Police believe the El Paso gunman </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/08/03/us/patrick-crusius-el-paso-shooter-manifesto.html?action=click&module=Spotlight&pgtype=Homepage&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announced</a></span><span> his intentions on an 8chan board and attached an anti-immigrant manifesto just minutes before the shooting.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The point:</strong> Have your message go viral and inspire others.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">So what is 8chan? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s a site <a href="https://www.vox.com/recode/2019/5/3/18527214/8chan-poway-synagogue-shooting-christchurch-john-earnest?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">launched</a> in 2013 by Fredrick Brennan that hosts user generated message boards. 8chan calls itself the “Darkest Reaches of the Internet,” and many counterterrorism experts wouldn’t disagree. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">While many extremist topics are discussed on 8chan, one particular board, /pol/, has become what journalist Robert Evans <a href="https://www.bellingcat.com/news/americas/2019/04/28/ignore-the-poway-synagogue-shooters-manifesto-pay-attention-to-8chans-pol-board/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">describes</a> as a haven for “extremely online neo-Nazis.” That’s where the three gunmen appeared to be active before their attacks. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Brennan doesn’t run the site anymore, and after the shooting in El Paso he doesn’t think anyone should. “Once again, a terrorist used 8chan to spread his message as he knew people would save it and spread it,” he <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2019/08/04/three-mass-shootings-this-year-began-with-hateful-screed-chan-its-founder-calls-it-terrorist-refuge-plain-sight/?utm_term=.e8a333cbb4ef&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">told the WaPo</a>. He said the current owner, Jim Watkins, should shut it down. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The future of 8chan </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">According to experts on extremism cited by the WaPo, 8chan is shielded by 1) hesitation by officials to link far-right ideology with terrorism and 2) laws that limit websites’ liability for user generated content. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But there has been pressure on SF-based tech firm Cloudflare, which protects websites from cyberthreats and provides services to 8chan. Cloudflare has said it doesn’t ditch customers based on website content, and CEO Matthew Prince defended that decision in an <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2019/aug/04/mass-shootings-el-paso-texas-dayton-ohio-8chan-far-right-website?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">interview with the Guardian</a> this weekend. He said Cloudflare can better flag illegal content for law enforcement with sites like 8chan in its network.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>+ Here's what <a href="https://abcnews.go.com/US/el-paso-community-calls-blood-donations-wake-shooting/story?id=64756506&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">you can do</a> to help Dayton and El Paso.</em></p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2019%2F08%2F05%2Fel-paso-attacks-traced-darkest-reaches-internet" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
RETAIL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/08/05/north-dakota-relaxing-blue-laws?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
North Dakota Relaxes Its Relaxation Law
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="No Alt" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83MTE5L2ZhcmdvX25vcnRoX2Rha290YV9icm9hZHdheV9qcGcuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Tim Kiser (w:User:Malepheasant), Fargo North Dakota Broadway, CC BY-SA 2.5</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Those of us who value our Sunday morning Target runs have had to steer clear of North Dakota—until now. Yesterday was <a href="https://apnews.com/ade09bb0818b4391a81dad4af16be686?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">the first Sunday</a> in which North Dakota retailers were allowed to operate from midnight–noon since 1889. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>North Dakota has had a “<a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Blue_laws_in_the_United_States?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">blue law</a>” banning most retail businesses from operating on Sundays ever since the state was founded. The law, intended to promote family values and churchgoing, was pared back in 1991 from all day to a half day, and in March the state legislature repealed it altogether. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The law’s opponents say it...</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Blocks people’s rights to decide whether they shop or rest. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Gives e-commerce a leg up over local, physical stores. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Limits sales tax revenue. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And as the state tax commissioner explained, “More hours in which to shop will mean more shopping will occur.” Don’t say you didn’t learn anything this morning. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">FYI</strong>, about a dozen states have Sunday sales laws. But North Dakota’s was the most strict. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">FYI x2</strong>, vehicle and alcohol sales <a href="https://bismarcktribune.com/news/local/govt-and-politics/little-to-no-interest-to-change-north-dakota-s-sunday/article_e6047d51-860e-5c31-8b6b-f6b97ad0a58a.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">will still be</a> subject to Sunday restrictions in North Dakota.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/08/05/facebook-marks-territory-subsidiaries?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Facebook Marks Its Territory
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="No Alt" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83MTE4LzEyMDBweC1tYXJrX3p1Y2tlcmJlcmdfZjhfMjAxOF9rZXlub3RlXzI4NDE3OTM0NjgxODJfMjlfanBnLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Anthony Quintano from Honolulu, HI, United States, Mark Zuckerberg F8 2018 Keynote (41793468182), CC BY 2.0</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Information <a href="https://www.theinformation.com/articles/facebook-to-add-its-name-to-instagram-whatsapp?mod=article_inline&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reported</a> Friday that Instagram and WhatsApp are going Facebook official—Facebook's name will be slapped onto theirs. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What that means: </strong>A “from Facebook” tag will be added to both brands. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why they’re doing it: </strong>Mark Zuckerberg is <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/facebook-shows-whos-boss-by-adding-its-name-to-instagram-whatsapp-11564796439?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reportedly</a> pushing for unity among Facebook’s apps as the company shifts its focus to private messaging.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Marketing for Facebook-owned Workplace, Portal, and Oculus already incorporates Facebook’s name. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The timing is...odd. </strong>The FTC is <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/ftc-antitrust-probe-of-facebook-scrutinizes-its-acquisitions-11564683965?mod=article_inline&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reportedly</a> looking into whether Facebook’s acquisitions of companies like Instagram and WhatsApp were smart strategy or smart monopoly. So Zuckerberg would be adding the Facebook name to its properties right as the government is investigating why Facebook has so many properties. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>We all know Facebook’s reputation has taken a shellacking. Zuckerberg’s trying to clean that up by associating Facebook more closely with its better-loved acquisitions.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TRANSPORTATION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/08/05/french-entrepreneur-across-channel?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Jetsons IRL: French Entrepreneur Hoverboards Across the Channel
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Jetsons IRL: French Entrepreneur Hoverboards Across the Channel" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="/images/<a%20href=%22https://media.giphy.com/media/jSF56uK0LiUWrw9wcm/giphy.gif%22%20target=%22_blank%22%20class=%22link%22%20rel=%22noopener%22>https://media.giphy.com/media/11RyXtjyMs9HVe/giphy.gif</a>">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If you’re a French inventor, former world jet ski champion, and named Franky Zapata, how do you spend your time? </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">There is only one answer: <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-08-04/french-flying-man-finally-succeeds-in-cross-channel-attempt?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">riding a hoverboard</a> you designed yourself across the English Channel. Zapata <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/08/04/world/europe/franky-zapata-hoverboard-uk-france.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">successfully completed</a> the hover-trip yesterday from Sangatte, France, to Kent, England, in 22 minutes. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The second time’s the charm. </strong>Zapata’s first try was July 25, but he <a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-49108632?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fell into the water</a> while trying to refuel. He announced plans for another attempt right after. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">More about Franky </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In 2011, the entrepreneur <a href="https://newatlas.com/zapata-flyboard-jet-pack-watersport-boots/20772/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">unveiled</a> the Flyboard, a wearable device that uses water to hoist you into the sky. But the flying machine he rode over the Channel (and at <a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JvEMQalsHWs&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Bastille Day</a> military celebrations in Paris last month) is called the <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2016/4/15/11439798/franky-zapata-racing-jet-powered-flying-hoverboard-interview?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Flyboard Air</a>, a jet-powered version of the Flyboard not attached to a watercraft. His company, Zapata Industries, got a major boost last year when it received a pledge of almost $1.5 million from the French Defense Ministry.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Some #MondayMotivation,</strong> courtesy of your favorite flying Frenchman: “The harder the job is, the more beautiful the victory is,” he said through tears at a press conference.</p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CALENDAR
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/08/05/week-ahead-august-5?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Week Ahead
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Clear your calendar: This Saturday is National Lazy Day.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Monday: </strong>Earnings (Loews, Marriott, Shake Shack, Tyson Foods) </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Tuesday: </strong>74th anniversary of the Hiroshima bombing; earnings (Disney, Discovery, HubSpot, Match Group, Planet Fitness); job openings data</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Wednesday: </strong>Samsung Galaxy Note 10 unveiling; earnings (Booking Holdings, CVS, Lyft, Monster Beverage, NYT, Roku, TripAdvisor, Zillow)</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Thursday: </strong>International Cat Day; DEF CON begins in Las Vegas; earnings (AMC, Dropbox, Uber, Activision Blizzard, Kraft Heinz), Roger Federer turns 38; PGA’s The Northern Trust begins</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Friday: </strong>Producer prices data; first day of the Hajj pilgrimage to Mecca; wipe down couch in preparation for National Lazy Day </p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">What started out in 2015 as a naive PDF at the University of Michigan is now a force in digital media. Come join our team as we take this thing to the next level. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Here are the positions currently available. If you see a fit, we encourage you or anyone you know to apply. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">1. <strong style="color:#000">Senior Brand Partner: </strong>We’re looking for a motivated and proven seller who is ready to roll up their sleeves and get creative with branded partnerships and native ad campaigns. <a href="https://jobs.lever.co/morningbrew/4b75271b-ff8c-4dfa-9e6e-83c589147b91?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Apply here</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">2. <strong style="color:#000">Growth Marketing Analyst: </strong>When you’re awake, you’re thinking about new growth channels. When you’re asleep, you dream about iterating on a campaign. Sound like you? <a href="https://jobs.lever.co/morningbrew/bd76e387-aadf-4b13-bb88-eaee6ab1017a?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Apply here</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">3. <strong style="color:#000">Editorial Coordinator: </strong>The glue that holds the editorial team together. If you’re obsessed with news, read endlessly, and write with a unique voice, come work with us. <a href="https://jobs.lever.co/morningbrew/bdf2a323-dfbf-4606-8dc3-0e704bc54859?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Apply here</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">4. <strong style="color:#000">Copywriter:</strong> You’ll sit at the intersection of sales and content, which means you’ll be writing top-notch copy and planning long-term campaigns. Are you a wizard with words? <a href="https://jobs.lever.co/morningbrew/7bcbe720-b003-4eb5-a020-9d9de256b46b?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Apply here</a>.</p>

href=\"https://slate.com/news-and-politics/2019/03/what-the-christchurch-attackers-manifesto-tells-us.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2019/04/29/us/san-diego-synagogue-shooting-fbi-tip/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca is 8chan? \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt’s a site \u003ca href=\"https://www.vox.com/recode/2019/5/3/18527214/8chan-poway-synagogue-shooting-christchurch-john-earnest?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elaunched\u003c/a\u003e in 2013 by Fredrick Brennan that hosts user generated message boards. 8chan calls itself the “Darkest Reaches of the Internet,” and many counterterrorism experts wouldn’t disagree. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhile many extremist topics are discussed on 8chan, one particular board, /pol/, has become what journalist Robert Evans \u003ca href=\"https://www.bellingcat.com/news/americas/2019/04/28/ignore-the-poway-synagogue-shooters-manifesto-pay-attention-to-8chans-pol-board/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edescribes\u003c/a\u003e as a haven for “extremely online neo-Nazis.” That’s where the three gunmen appeared to be active before their attacks. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBrennan doesn’t run the site anymore, and after the shooting in El Paso he doesn’t think anyone should. “Once again, a terrorist used 8chan to spread his message as he knew people would save it and spread it,” he \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2019/08/04/three-mass-shootings-this-year-began-with-hateful-screed-chan-its-founder-calls-it-terrorist-refuge-plain-sight/?utm_term=.e8a333cbb4ef\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etold the WaPo\u003c/a\u003e. He said the current owner, Jim Watkins, should shut it down. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe future of 8chan \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAccording to experts on extremism cited by the WaPo, 8chan is shielded by 1) hesitation by officials to link far-right ideology with terrorism and 2) laws that limit websites’ liability for user generated content. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut there has been pressure on SF-based tech firm Cloudflare, which protects websites from cyberthreats and provides services to 8chan. Cloudflare has said it doesn’t ditch customers based on website content, and CEO Matthew Prince defended that decision in an \u003ca href=\"https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2019/aug/04/mass-shootings-el-paso-texas-dayton-ohio-8chan-far-right-website?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003einterview with the Guardian\u003c/a\u003e this weekend. He said Cloudflare can better flag illegal content for law enforcement with sites like 8chan in its network.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cem\u003e+ Here's what \u003ca href=\"https://abcnews.go.com/US/el-paso-community-calls-blood-donations-wake-shooting/story?id=64756506\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eyou can do\u003c/a\u003e to help Dayton and El Paso.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-top: 12px;\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2019%2F08%2F05%2Fel-paso-attacks-traced-darkest-reaches-internet\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83MTE5L2ZhcmdvX25vcnRoX2Rha290YV9icm9hZHdheV9qcGcuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eTim Kiser (w:User:Malepheasant), Fargo North Dakota Broadway, CC BY-SA 2.5\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThose of us who value our Sunday morning Target runs have had to steer clear of North Dakota—until now. Yesterday was \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/ade09bb0818b4391a81dad4af16be686?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ethe first Sunday\u003c/a\u003e in which North Dakota retailers were allowed to operate from midnight–noon since 1889. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003eNorth Dakota has had a “\u003ca href=\"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Blue_laws_in_the_United_States?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eblue law\u003c/a\u003e” banning most retail businesses from operating on Sundays ever since the state was founded. The law, intended to promote family values and churchgoing, was pared back in 1991 from all day to a half day, and in March the state legislature repealed it altogether. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe law’s opponents say it...\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBlocks people’s rights to decide whether they shop or rest. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eGives e-commerce a leg up over local, physical stores. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eLimits sales tax revenue. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAnd as the state tax commissioner explained, “More hours in which to shop will mean more shopping will occur.” Don’t say you didn’t learn anything this morning. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFYI\u003c/strong\u003e, about a dozen states have Sunday sales laws. But North Dakota’s was the most strict. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFYI x2\u003c/strong\u003e, vehicle and alcohol sales \u003ca href=\"https://bismarcktribune.com/news/local/govt-and-politics/little-to-no-interest-to-change-north-dakota-s-sunday/article_e6047d51-860e-5c31-8b6b-f6b97ad0a58a.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewill still be\u003c/a\u003e subject to Sunday restrictions in North border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe Information “from Facebook” tag will be added to both brands. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhy they’re doing it: \u003c/strong\u003eMark Zuckerberg is \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/facebook-shows-whos-boss-by-adding-its-name-to-instagram-whatsapp-11564796439?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereportedly\u003c/a\u003e pushing for unity among Facebook’s apps as the company shifts its focus to private messaging.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eMarketing for Facebook-owned Workplace, Portal, and Oculus already incorporates Facebook’s name. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe timing is...odd. \u003c/strong\u003eThe FTC is \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/ftc-antitrust-probe-of-facebook-scrutinizes-its-acquisitions-11564683965?mod=article_inline\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIf you’re a French inventor, former world jet ski champion, and named Franky Zapata, how do you spend your time? \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThere is only one answer: \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-08-04/french-flying-man-finally-succeeds-in-cross-channel-attempt?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eriding a hoverboard\u003c/a\u003e you designed yourself across the English Channel. Zapata \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/08/04/world/europe/franky-zapata-hoverboard-uk-france.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esuccessfully completed\u003c/a\u003e the hover-trip yesterday from Sangatte, France, to Kent, England, in 22 minutes. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe second time’s the charm. \u003c/strong\u003eZapata’s first try was July 25, but he \u003ca href=\"https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-49108632?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efell into the water\u003c/a\u003e while trying to refuel. He announced plans for another attempt right after. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eMore about Franky \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn 2011, the entrepreneur \u003ca href=\"https://newatlas.com/zapata-flyboard-jet-pack-watersport-boots/20772/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eunveiled\u003c/a\u003e the Flyboard, a wearable device that uses water to hoist you into the sky. But the flying machine he rode over the Channel (and at \u003ca href=\"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JvEMQalsHWs\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eBastille Day\u003c/a\u003e military celebrations in Paris last month) is called the \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2016/4/15/11439798/franky-zapata-racing-jet-powered-flying-hoverboard-interview?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eFlyboard Air\u003c/a\u003e, a jet-powered version of the Flyboard not attached to a watercraft. His company, Zapata Industries, got a major boost last year when it received a pledge of almost $1.5 million from the French Defense Ministry.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSome #MondayMotivation,\u003c/strong\u003e courtesy of your favorite flying Frenchman: “The
